result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Warner Roeglin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Warner Roeglin in court.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Jason Warner Roeglin.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defense counsel informed the Court this case may be Deferred Prosecution Agreement eligible and requests additional time to allow defendant to schedule TAD evaluation. Court grants request.
Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 098685,
Payable Number: 1039139,
Receipt Number: 22RP041528,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-07-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jason Warner Roeglin in court.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Jason Warner Roeglin.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jason Warner Roeglin not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8/8/22 @ 1p
